results.title: The Snow queen
results.creator_credit: Martin Gates Productions, Carrington Productions and Martin Gates
results.brief_description: Based on Hans Christian Anderson’s fairy tale, this is a story of kidnapping, magic and the heroic adventure of a young girl, Ellie, to thwart the evil Snow Queen who plots to turn the world to ice. After her brother is kidnapped by the Snow Queen to help her build a mirror to deflect the sun and freeze the planet, the courageous Ellie begins a journey with a reluctant bird named Peep. With a little help from magic she sets out to rescue her brother and defeat the Snow Queen. Released by Warner Brothers Family Entertainment this is an engaging story of adventure and the classic triumph of good over evil.

results.title: The Snow queen
results.brief_description: Gerda, a little girl who sets out on an amazing journey to find her friend Kay, who has fallen under the evil spell of the Snow Queen. On her journey she has to contend with the Summer garden witch, the robbers in the wood, and the Snow Queen herself. Only Gerda, helped by birds and animals, has the power to overcome them all.

results.title: The Snow is black = La Neige est noire
results.brief_description: Boy scouts go to the Alps to learn how to ski and to build their confidence. They are taught the techniques of skiing and the idea of group cooperation and friendship. In French with no subtitles.

results.title: The Snapping turtle
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows the life cycle of a typical reptile, the snapping turtle - its birth, its growth, and its struggle for existence and survival. Natural photography reveals its activities, its encounters with other animal life, how it gets its food and lays its eggs, how its young hatch and develop, and how it hibernates.

results.title: The Snapper
results.creator_credit: BBC Film Unit, Lynda Myles and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: The Curley’s are a working class Dublin family headed by Dessie, (Colm Meaney), an affable plasterer with a taste for the drink, and Kay, (Ruth McCabe), who keeps their six children in line. This topsy-turvy household falls into a tailspin when 20 year-old Sharon, (Tina Kellegher) announces that she is pregnant. Tensions mount when it becomes obvious that she has no intention of revealing the child’s paternity. As the time approaches for the little “snapper’ to be born, Dessie is becoming a New Age Man while Sharon learns to turn life’s little “accidents’ into big achievements. This is a delightful Irish comedy, well handled by director Frears and with quality performances by Meany and Kellegher.

results.title: The Snails = Les Escargots
results.creator_credit: Societe des Films d'Art et de Culture
results.brief_description: Animated science fiction fantasy about man’s inability to learn from his mistakes. Depicts a peasant who discovers that his tears will make his crops grow, but snails appear, consume the crops and become monstrous creatures. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Snails = Le'escargots
results.creator_credit: Societe des Films d'Art et de Culture and Rene Laloux
results.brief_description: An animated story about man’s inability to learn from his mistakes. A market gardener’s plants are dying and his tears revive the plants, but snails quickly appear, consume his crop, and become mammoths. They move about destroying all, but the city is rebuilt and the cycle begins again.

results.title: The Smoking machine
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, J.B. Holmes and Sarah Erulkar
results.brief_description: A group of young children are approached by an older friend Jim, who offers them a choice. Disgusted with the taste and curious about why people smoke they set out in their neighbourhood and study people who smoke. They stumble across a smoking machine and examine its insides to discover what smoking does to the inside of one’s body.

results.title: The Smithsonian Institution
results.creator_credit: IBM, Charles Eames and Ray Eames
results.brief_description: As close to a dramatic feature as the Eameses ever got in this tribute commissioned for the 125th anniversary of the Smithsonian Institution. Dramatises the early history and development of the Smithsonian Institution, which began with the unusual bequest of Englishman James Smithson. Traces the growth of the Smithsonian from a small research centre and repository of museum collections to its modern position. In addition to the dramatic recreation, this film also uses paintings, sculpture and other works of art to recreate the period. Narrated by Alistair Cooke, prologue by Walter Cronkite, advice and counsel by John Houseman. Appearing are Ronald Long, Arnold Moss and Alan Napier.

results.title: The Smile of a tour guide = Nide Weixiao
results.creator_credit: Beijing Film Studio and Ma Bingyu
results.brief_description:
Ms Chen is a local tour guide in the city of Suzhou. One day she meets a strange client who refuses to join the travel group for sightseeing and locks himself in the hotel room every day. Ms Chen gradually came to know that this special guest, Mr Song, left China to seek his fortune abroad when he was young. Now that Mr Song is getting old and has become a rich businessman, he wants to trace his memories of the past on this homebound trip. With Ms Chen’s patience and hospitality, the two become friends and Ms Chen shows Mr Song around the city. It happened that they came across the son of Mr Song’s old acquaintance’s, which made the old man extremely happy. Mr Song donated a valuable antique to the local government of Suzhou for his gratitude before he left. In another tour group, two World War II Japanese veterans came back to China with a sense of guilt for as they robbed two gold rings from the Chinese during the War. Now they wish to return them to the owners. Ms Chen has mixed feelings for the veterans as her grandfather was killed by the Japanese during the War. However, she tries all her best to help her Japanese guests. On another occasion, Ms Chen helped two young men from Hong Kong to quit drugs. Chen enjoys her work as a tour guide but feels lost when she is alone, because both she and her friend, Louise, are in love with a Chinese teacher. Louise ended up leaving the Chinese teacher, and Chen chose not to develop the relationship further. She continues to work as a tour guide, showing the beautiful scenery of Suzhou to guests from all over the world, with a smile always in her face.

The film was made in 1986, the International Year of Peace.While a lot of anti-Japanese war films deal with the cruelty of the Japanese invaders, this film represents the mutual understanding of the people from the two countries. Suzhou is a popular tourist city in China and the film shows the scenery of the city. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; May 21, 2010)
